intro: Crotalaria namuliensis, commonly known as the Namuli crotalaria, is a flowering plant native to the highlands of eastern Africa. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which is characterized by its leguminous properties and nitrogen-fixing capabilities. The plant typically grows as an upright shrub with compound leaves and produces distinctive yellow or orange flowers. Its seeds are enclosed in pods and are often used in traditional medicine due to their potential pharmacological properties. The species is of interest to botanists and ecologists due to its unique adaptations to high-altitude environments.
